title: Around the Districts : Manorhamilton , Merville Centre , Riverstown and Skreen - Dromard
body_text:
Around the Districts: Manorhamilton, Merville Centre, Riverstown and Skreen-Dromard
Around the Districts
Manorhamilton
Football Awards
The Glenfarne/Kiltyclogher GAA Club honoured a number of its 2025 outstanding players and a club-person at a local ceremony during the recent Festive Season.
During the Glenfarne/Kiltyclogher GAA Club ceremony Team Manager Tom Reilly presented the Junior Player of the Year award to Conor Rooney; the Young Player of the Year award to Hugh Clancy; the Senior Player of the Year award to Oisín McDermott and the club-person of the Year award to Anthony Clancy.
Afterwards a Glenfarne/Kiltyclogher GAA Club spokesperson wished a “Happy New Year to all our players and members, at home and abroad. We wish everyone the very best for 2026.” On recent welcome new arrivals the club spokesperson noted that “it was a busy end to the year, and we’re thrilled to welcome three of our newest supporters to the Glenfarne/Kilty family.
“Congratulations to Fergal and Danielle on the birth of baby Cillian, to Diarmuid and Jess on Caragh, and to Ciarán and Shauna (joining us from Australia) on Téidi. A huge congratulations to all from everyone in Glenfarne and Kiltyclogher,” the spokesperson added.
Credit Union Sponsorships
It was revealed that no less than eighteen different local organisations, projects and groups benefited in their operations from Manorhamilton and District Credit Union sponsorships during 2025 at the Credit Union’s recent AGM.
Among the eighteen local organisations, projects and groups that received Credit Union sponsorship last year were Cluainín Carnival, St Clare’s Comprehensive (School) Entrepreneurs, Garda Awards, Glencar Manor G4M and O, Glenfarne Community Festival, Glenfarne/Kiltyclogher GFC, IMNDA, Josie Martin Award, Kiltyclogher Drama Festival, Manorhamilton Tidy Towns Committee, Manorhamilton Agricultural Show, Manorhamilton Tennis Club, North Leitrim Glens Run, North Leitrim Men’s Group, North Leitrim Women’s Group, North West Hospice, Rabbit Riot Theatre Group and Shannon Gaels GFC.
ALONE Volunteers Appeal
ALONE recruits, trains, and supports volunteers for two key local services, namely, the visitation of older people in the community and befriending them also.
Volunteers give one hour per week to provide companionship to an older person. Telephone support and befriending service: Volunteers make friendly weekly calls to older people.
ALONE currently has older people in Manorhamilton and the surrounding area awaiting both services. For more information or to get involved, please visit alone.ie or contact Collette, at 086 1921505 or collette.ferguson@alone.ie.
Special Needs Assistant Course
The North Leitrim Women’s Centre QQI Level 5 Special Needs Assistants and Work Placement course will take place in the Bee Park Community Centre on Mondays and Tuesdays between February and May this year from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day.
This course is free of charge. To book a place on course please contact the North Leitrim Women’s Centre, phone 071 9856220.
Ballroom Dancing
A ballroom dancing class will take place in Ballintogher Community Centre (F91XW71) on Wednesday night, January 14, starting at 7 p.m. For further details on Wednesday night’s class please contact Kieran – phone 087 7414968.
District News Deadline
Please email all notes for next week’s Sligo Champion Manorhamilton District News to PJ Leddy – leddypatrick10@gmail.com by 6 p.m. at the latest on Thursday, January 15.
Merville Centre
Condolences
The Merville Centre Management Committee, staff and the Wider Merville Community wish to express our Sincere Condolences to the families and Friends of Jason Bradley, three Hazel Grove, Maugheraboy, formerly of Wolfe Tone St, Derek Gannon, Cedar Drive and Jim Henry, Rathedmond Estate, Formerly of Treacy Avenue, all who have passed away over the Christmas Period. Ar dheis Dé go raibh a n-anamacha
PATHWAY TO EMPLOYMENT
Our New Department of Social Protection Community Employment (CE) Project with 20 persons now employed with developmental Supports in a wide range of Roles across Our Community. CE is a great option for those both on Long Term Payments and those on a lower social welfare rate as it involves increased payment on to the higher CE rate, while providing work experience/training for 19.5 hours a week. All underlying prior entitlements are retained during placement. New Qualification Rules now apply so you may qualify especially if you are over 50 Years and Unemployed for over 12 Months. Community Employment vacancies at Merville are currently available for General Operatives, School Age Care (Afternoons) and Caretakers (Evenings and Weekends). No Experience is necessary as full training will be provided. Get involved in working in your community while availing Career Changing Opportunities. Call 071 9150029 for further information.
YOUR NOTES
Local Voluntary and Community Groups are reminded that any notices for publication can be emailed to mervilleycc@gmail.com or hard copy left into the Merville Centre for inclusion in our Local Notes.
Riverstown
Shamrock Gaels dinner dance
The annual Shamrock Gaels dinner dance will take place on the Bank Holiday weekend Sunday, February 1. Traditionally a fantastic night it will also be a opportunity to celebrate the all conquering Men’s Senior Team, winning the league and championship along with the Ladies’ Senior team who were runners-up in the Junior A championship. Tickets are available from any committee member. The Shamrock Gaels Club will be participating in the Irish Life GAA Healthy Clubs step challenge from early January to Wednesday, February 11, with a chance to share €30,000 in club funding. Download the Irish Life app and register to take part. Open the app and select the social tab at the bottom, select challenges, Connacht and then select Shamrock Gaels.
PILATES CLASS
Pilates classes will take place in the Morrison Teach Ceoil starting on Monday, January 12. Beginners’ class starts at 6 p.m. and intermediate class starts at 7 p.m. To book a place go to sligopilates.com. For further information call Oliver at 086 0846849.
DANCING CLASSES
Sean nós Dancing Classes with Bróga Bríomhar Dance School will be resuming in the Morrison Teach Ceoil in Riverstown on Thursday, January 22. Kids Class from 5 p.m. to 5.30 p.m., Intermediates 5.30 p.m. to 6 p.m. and Advanced teenagers from 6 p.m. to 6.40 p.m. There will also be kids classes in Teeling Centre, Collooney on Friday, January 23, from 5 p.m. to 5.30 p.m. To register call 086 2584465. Join Bróga Bríomhar Dance School today.
BALLROOM DANCING
Ballroom Dancing Classes will take place in Ballintogher Community Centre (F91 XW71) starting on Wednesday, January 14, from 7 p.m. Beginners €15 per person. Solo dancers very welcome. Further details are available from Kieran at 087 7414968.
FUNDRAISING CONCERT
Glór na dTonn, all-Ireland Champions 2025, will take part in a fundraising concert with in memory of Paul and Linda Judge on Friday, February 6, at 8 p.m., (doors open at 7.30 p.m.). All proceeds in aid of Mayo Roscommon Hospice. Concert takes place in the Great National Hotel Ballina, County Mayo (F26 X5P3). Tickets are €25 and available on the Mayo Roscommon Hospice website.
COMMUNITY NOTES
Please email carrowcashel@eircom.net or alternatively text or call Iris at 086 8258525 to have news items included in Riverstown Community News.
Skreen-Dromard
Skreen-Dromard Drama Production
The Skreen-Dromard Drama Group will present their current production ‘One Wife too Many’ a hilarious three-act comedy by Jimmy Keary, in the following venues over the coming weeks – January 17 in the Hawk’s Well Theatre Sligo and Culfadda County Sligo on January 24. Tickets for the January 17 show are now on sale from the Hawks Well box office.
January Social Dances
The Second Social Dance for the month of January in the Skreen-Dromard Community Centre will take place on Saturday, January 31, with music supplied by Bernie Heaney. Dancing from 9 p.m. and everyone welcome.
Indoor Walking Football
Following a successful Demo Day of Walking Football, a Weekly Class will start in the New Year.
The start date for this event was Thursday, January 8, 2026, at midday in the Skreen-Dromard Community Centre. It will continue every Thursday for five weeks. The fee for this event is €25 paid on the first day or €7 per class. Everyone, who is interested is encouraged to commit to attending in order to have enough people participating.
If you or someone you know is interested, contact the community centre office at 087 6649635.
Dromore West Sings Concert
The Dromore West Sings Concert will take place on February 13 and 14 in Templeboy Church. Tickets are now on sale .Links to purchase tickets will be posted on all their social media pages from then or tickets can be got by searching for ‘Dromore West Sings’ on the website eventbrite.com.
